answerText: A star search[10] For optimality in the tree-search version of A star, the search's heuristic must have this property, meaning that it never overestimates the distance to the goal state.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2015 | Brown A + University of Washington + Notre Dame A | 21 | Science | Computer Science | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This form of search evaluates nodes by combining its path cost from the start node with a heuristic estimating the distance to the goal node. For 10 points each: [10] Name this widely-used form of best-first search differentiated from uniform cost search by its usage of a heuristic. The graph-search version of this technique is guaranteed to be optimal if its heuristic is consistent.
